title: How to Create a VHS Tape from a Video File

steps.title: Determine whether or not your graphics card can support s-video or composite video output.
steps.content: Determine whether or not your graphics card can support s-video or composite video output.

steps.title: If it does, plug your VCR input into the video card output.
steps.content: If it does, plug your VCR input into the video card output.

steps.title: Plug your sound card into the audio input on your VCR.
steps.content: Plug your sound card into the audio input on your VCR.

steps.title: Set your computer to use the video out.
steps.content: Set your computer to use the video out.

steps.title: Open your media player in full screen mode on the video out.
steps.content: Open your media player in full screen mode on the video out.

steps.title: Press the record button on your VCR.
steps.content: Press the record button on your VCR.

steps.title: Play the video on your computer.
steps.content: Play the video on your computer.

steps.title: When the video finishes, press stop on the VCR.
steps.content: When the video finishes, press stop on the VCR.
